headline: 'The Five' on Schiff's credibility over discredited Trump-Russia dossier

utterances.speaker: THOMAS BINGER, ASSISTANT DISTRICT ATTORNEY, KENOSHA COUNTY
utterances.sentences: This is the BG on the scene video. Go ahead. Pause. Now, we've heard a lot of testimony about this person who comes up behind you with something and hits you in the head. We have heard about Anthony Huber's first approach to you with his skateboard. Correct?

utterances.speaker: KYLE RITTENHOUSE, ACCUSED SHOOTER, KENOSHA SHOOTING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You testified that after a few more feet, you felt light-headed and you stumble. That's what you told when your attorneys was asking you questions, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: No one knocked you to the ground. You lost your arm balanced, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I was hit to the point where I stumbled.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You said in response to your attorney's questions that you stumbled because you were light-headed. Do you remember telling us that?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: From getting hit, yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You were light-headed because you had been running, and you were being chased. That is why you were light-headed, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: That and being hit, yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Let's continue. Pause. There is an individual who comes at you and jumps towards you and attempts to kick you, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: He does kick me, yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you fire two shots directly at him with your AR-15.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You intended to hit him with those bullets, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I intended for him -- yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: At that close range, it's a miracle that you missed, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You intended to kill him with those shots, didn't you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Did you even care whether or not those two rounds were going to kill him?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I didn't want to have to kill anybody that night.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: In this moment, you are making a deliberate decision to pull the trigger twice, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: That wasn't an accident. That was your conscious decision, wasn't it?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you are firing an AR-15 at close range to this individual, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you knew full well that if you hit him with one or both of those bullets, it could kill him, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: There is that possibility.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: If you hit him with one of those, wouldn't you agree it's a pretty strong likelihood you are going to kill him?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Did that even factor into your mind at that point? Did you even care if you were going to kill him or not?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I didn't want to have to kill anybody. I was being attacked. That's why I shot him -- I shot at him.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You shot at him with the intent of hitting him and killing him, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I didn't want to kill anybody.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Then why are you shooting at someone with an AR-15 at close range if you don't want to kill him?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Because he is attacking me. And he was stomping my face in, jumping and kicking --

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: That --

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: -- my face in.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: That you didn't see any weapons on that person, did you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You didn't see a gun.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You didn't see a knife.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You didn't see a bat or a club.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You didn't see a chain.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: All he uses is one foot, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Let's continue the video. Pause. You've just shot around into Anthony Huber's chest, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Now up until this moment, and probably for the rest of that evening, you did not know the name Anthony Huber, did you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I did not.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Up until this moment in this evening, you had never had any interaction with him, took any notice of him, fair to say?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And when you shoot him, he's got his skateboard in his hand?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You didn't see any gun in his hand, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You didn't see a knife?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You didn't see a bat?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You didn't see a club?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: All he's got is the skateboard, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: That he has hit me in the head with twice, yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: OK. And you intended to pull the trigger at that moment with your AR-15, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: That wasn't an accident.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: That was your deliberate decision, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you knew that the way that gun was positioned, you were going to fire that bullet right into his chest, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: He was attacking me, so I pulled the trigger.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you knew that when you pulled that trigger, that bullet was going to go right into his chest, didn't you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I can't say -- I don't know where the bullet would have went exactly.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: The end of that gun was pointed directly at his chest when you pulled the trigger, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you knew that, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you still pulled the trigger, didn't you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Because you intended to kill Anthony Huber at that moment, didn't you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: What did you think was going to happen then? You've got a gun that's aimed directly at his chest, you pull the trigger, what did you think was going to happen?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: If I didn't pull the trigger, I thought Mr. Huber was going to kill me.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Maybe I misphrase my question. Let me try again. When you pull the trigger of the AR-15, and it is directly against Anthony Huber's chest, what did you think was going to happen to Anthony Huber?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: That he would no longer be a threat to my safety.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Because he would be dead, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Because he wouldn't be a threat to me. I don't know if he would be done or not.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Did you even care at that moment whether or not Anthony Huber lived or died?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Your only concern in that moment was your own safety, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: The next shooting is of Gaige Grosskreutz. We have stopped the video at a moment here when he is crouched in front of you with his hands in the air. Correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Your gun is pointed at him, isn't it?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: It's pointed downward towards his feet.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: It's pointed at some part of his body, some part of his body, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And he is no threat to you at this moment, is he?

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Correction, your honor, he's in front of them with a gun.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: That's an argument you can make. I'm asking a question of the witness.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: You can answer the question.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: He is no threat to you at this moment, is he?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: He is a threat. He has a gun in his hand.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You saw that gun?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: So, at the moment throughout all of these moments of your interaction with Mr. Grosskreutz, you were aware of the fact that he had that gun in his hand, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Not until that moment.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: I'm talking about from this moment on. Correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And of course, that's a handgun, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you have an AR-15, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And at this particular moment, he's not pointing his gun at you, is he?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Not at that moment.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: But you got your gun pointed at him, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Looking at the video, I think I'm lowering my weapon. I think it's just a still shot of where you have it there to where at that, but I believe in the whole video, I'm lowering it, and then he points his gun at me.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Can you help me understand, Mr. Rittenhouse, why Gaige Grosskreutz with a pistol in his hand, is a threat to kill you, but you with an AR-15 pointed at him is not a threat to kill him at this moment? Can you help me understand that?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I have been attacked by several people, and he decided to come and point a gun at my head. Well, first --

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: He hasn't done that yet, has he?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: So, again, I ask you, in this moment, you told us Gaige Grosskreutz is a threat to you right now.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: He's got a pistol not aimed at you. You have got an AR-15 aimed at him. Why is he more of a threat to you than you are to him?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Because he was -- he was moving at me with a gun in his hand.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: This is right after you've killed Anthony Huber, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Right after you fired two shots at almost point-blank range at the man running towards the camera right now and missing him, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you are telling us Gaige Grosskreutz is the real threat at this moment?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Can we please pull up exhibit number 80, beginning at frame 468. This is an exhibit which consists of -- what's 732? Seven hundred twenty- nine frames from the BG on the go video that we just watched. This is prepared by James Armstrong the state crime lab. I'm not going to show all 729, but I'd like to start at frame 468. And we are going to go frame by frame from there until frame 500. Mr. Stuke (Ph), could you please slowly advance frame by frame until I tell you to stop? Pause. Mr. Rittenhouse, this is immediately after Gaige Grosskreutz has stopped in front of you and you are doing something with your firearm at that moment. Do you recall that?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You were asked some questions about what you were doing at that moment. Is it fair to say that you turn your firearm over and you're looking at it, you're examining it?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: But your testimony is you didn't do anything to actually manipulate it at that moment.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Is that fair to say?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: OK. Please continue. Frame 500 shows you firing your AR-15 towards Gaige Grosskreutz. At this particular moment, he does not have that pistol pointed towards you, does he?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: He does.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: His left leg has stepped across in an -- not directly towards you, but to the side of you, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: He is reaching in with his left arm towards you, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: He never steps back and puts the gun in both hands in a ready aim position towards you, does he?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: He doesn't do that.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: He never takes that gun with his right hand and stands there and hold it up with his right hand in front of him and aims it directly at you, does he?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No, he does this pointing it directly at my head.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you thought that's the way he was going to shoot you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You thought he ran up close to you to shoot you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You understand that he could have taken that gun if he wanted to and shot you from 10, 15, 20 feet away, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Can you re -- sorry, I'm trying to understand the question.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You understand that a pistol like that doesn't need to be right up close to someone to shoot, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: It can shoot from 10, 15, 20 feet away.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Mr. Grosskreutz could have stopped 10, 15, 20 feet away if he wanted to shoot you and fired his pistol at you, couldn't he?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: He could have, but he didn't.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And your testimony is that you believe he ran up close to you and reached in with his left hand with his gun on his right hand, because that was his way of using this gun to shoot you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Did you think he was reaching in to grab your gun?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You didn't think he was going to take your gun away, did you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I thought he was going to shoot me.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: With his pistol?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Which he never actually does. Correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: He never fires that gun at you at all.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: In fact, in this entire sequence of events, no one ever fired a gun at you, did they?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Mr. Ziminski fired a gun from behind me.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Did Mr. Ziminski fire that gun at you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I believe so.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: What did you base that on, did you see it?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: The video?

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Did you see it?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: That's -- you are talking about back when the incident with Mr. Rosenbaum happens, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: That happened while you and Mr. Rosenbaum were running across the Car Source lot (Ph), correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: At that moment in time, you didn't see Joshua Ziminski fire a shot, did you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You heard a gunshot, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: But had no idea who fired it.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I believed it was Mr. Ziminski.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: So, that gunshot did not at all factor in your decision to kill Joseph Rosenbaum, did it?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No, Mr. Rosenbaum trying to see if my gun dead.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: So, you didn't think that was a gunshot from Joseph Rosenbaum?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You knew he didn't have a gun.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: I see what your question means now. You didn't think the shot was -- it had been fired supposedly by Mr. Ziminski had been fired by Mr. Rosenbaum.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: OK. OK.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: So, you heard a gunshot. You now know that was Joshua Ziminski based on watching the videos, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: But at the time, you didn't think that was Joseph Rosenbaum firing that shot, did you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You knew Joseph Rosenbaum didn't have a gun, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you certainly would agree with that you don't have the right to kill Joseph Rosenbaum for something Joshua Ziminski does, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: When you heard that gunshot, you didn't know whether it was fired at you or up in the air or at Rosenbaum or anyone else, did you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I heard it from behind me, but I didn't --

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You didn't know where it was aimed, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You didn't feel it hit you, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You didn't hear it ricochet anywhere near you, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You received no indication that that gunshot was going to put your life in danger, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: There were gunshots going off all night long, weren't there?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Sort of?

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Firecrackers, gun shots.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Fire -- yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Hard to tell the difference?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Right after you kill Rosenbaum, there's three shots after that, aren't there?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: From very close to where you were.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Yet you don't turn and shoot anybody there after you hear those, did you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: So, getting back to my original question. In this entire sequence of events, no one ever fired a shot at you, did they?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: After you kill Anthony Huber, shoot Gaige Grosskreutz, and attempt to fire those two shots at the person who jumped at you, you got up and you walked away, didn't you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you are about what, a block away from the police line?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you know that police lines there because you are running towards it?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And there's really nothing in the road between you and that police line, is there? After the shooting?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Everybody scatters?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No. Nothing in the road.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: So, you have a clear line of sight from where you did those shootings to those law enforcement vehicles, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you still have your AR-15.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And the crowd is pretty much run after they hear the shots, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You still have your medic bag --

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: -- correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You never once offered to help anybody you just shot, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I don't.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Correct, you don't?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Anthony Huber is lying there over on the ground after you shot him once in the chest. Correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You didn't know at that point whether he was alive or dead, did you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I didn't.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You never went over to check, did you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You didn't know whether if it was possible to save his life at that moment, did you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I didn't.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you didn't even care? You just kept on walking, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I kept walking to get to the police line.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Gaige Grosskreutz, right after you shoot him in the arm, is yelling "I need a medic." Did you hear that?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: That's in the videos, isn't it?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You don't do anything to help him, do you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You just decide to get out of there as fast as you can, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: If you had seen someone running up the street with a gun and the crowd was saying that that person just shot someone, like they were saying about you, you would have taken action to stop them yourself, wouldn't you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No, I wouldn't have.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You are running around putting out fires, aren't you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Shootings are far more serious than a fire, isn't it?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You took it upon yourself to do the things that the police and fire weren't doing that -- fire departments weren't doing that night, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I helped put out fires, but I wouldn't say that.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You went around offering medical service because you didn't think there were EMTs or EMS that would be able to come in there, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: So, you took it upon yourself to do the things that you didn't think the police or fire could do, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I wouldn't say I took it upon myself, but I would -- I was helping people with first aid and putting out fires at businesses.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: So, if you saw someone running with a gun and everybody said "that got shot someone," he would have taken your AR-15 and try to stop him, wouldn't you?

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Irrelevance, Mr. (Inaudible).

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: It goes to the crowd's reaction to him, your honor. I think he would have reacted the same way.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Mr. Rittenhouse is at a trial.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: The crowd is important in terms of it's a factor that bears on some of the accounts as to what the surroundings were. Otherwise, the crowd is unimportant. And what the crowd what he might have done vis-a-vis the crowd is, I don't see where we are going.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Understood. When you got back to that police line, and they, what did you say, they pepper sprayed you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I believe so, but I don't remember it.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: They told you to get out of the road --

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: -- because they were going in there --

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: -- to do what you hadn't done, which is to try and help the people that you just shot, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And then you went back after that to the 59th Street Car Source, didn't you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And you told them that you just shot someone.

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Someone, meaning an individual person, correct?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I wasn't meaning an individual. I was saying I just shot someone. I just shot someone.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You were told by Nick Smith that the police were coming to your location to the 59th Street Car Source, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I don't recall that.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And yet, you decided to flee, didn't you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You didn't stick around for the police, did you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I -- I want to go turn myself into the Antioch Police Department.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: A couple of hours later?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: An hour --

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Correction. It wasn't a couple of hours. (Inaudible) for time he was.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: I'm asking the witness if the witness can answer.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Go ahead, you can answer, sir.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: It was a couple of hours later, wasn't it?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: And in between leaving that location in downtown Kenosha and getting to Antioch, you were looking at social media, weren't you?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No, I wasn't. My phone was dead.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You heard from other people that your name was out there, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: Later on in the evening, I believe I heard something, but no.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You knew that your picture was out there, right?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: You are telling me as you sit here, under oath, that after those shootings, between then and the time you turned yourself into the Antioch Police Department, you had no idea that there was a social media out there with your picture and name as the shooter?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.sentences: I'm trying to recall, but I -- I can't. I'm trying to remember. I'm sorry, I don't remember.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Any further questions?

utterances.speaker: BINGER
utterances.sentences: Nothing further, your honor.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: You may step down, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Your honor -- before calling a witness, I need to use the men's room.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE SCHROEDER, JUDGE, KENOSHA COUNTY CIRCUIT
utterances.sentences: About a 5-to-10-minute break? Please don't talk about the case during the break. You may either use the jury room or you may remain down here in the library.

utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: I was just checking, how long after the two murders and the one assault or attempted murder the charges were filed? Because this video, the drone, and all of the other information that's been brought together, it took a while to put together -- but this D.A. charged Rittenhouse within 48 hours. So, the D.A. never really looked into whether or not there was a possibility of self-defense. He just immediately indicted him. And what you are seeing today is a D.A. who was reacting to the whole scenario of what we were doing in a post George Floyd world, in an area where Jacob Blake had just been shot. You've got a young guy who was a, you know, new CPR, he was a police explorer, he was some kind of fireman cadet. He was a good kid. He went there to clean up the graffiti on the buildings. He has -- he was exemplified, on that witness stand what every defendant should learn to do. And that is to speak clearly, directly. He stops exactly where he should stop. He doesn't add any further information. He listens exquisitely to the questions, and he -- you know, there isn't even a knee down the part of the defense attorney to object to this prosecutor who is so desperate, so out of control that he's even got the judge going through the roof in that courtroom. The bottom line here is that this kid has established that when he shot Rosenbaum, the first victim, he was in fear for his own life. When he shot the second guy, Huber, he was in fear legitimately and reasonably of his own life, and when he shot Grosskreutz, the third guy who didn't die, for which he is being charged with attempted murder, he had legitimate grounds for which he used deadly physical force. So now the question is whether or not the prosecutor can prove now because the burden of proof has shifted beyond a reasonable doubt, that it was not self defense. He can't do it. He can't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, yesterday, Geraldo, you said that you thought that this trial might not even go to the point where you have the defendant take the witness stand, but he did. And perhaps that might have been the best thing that he could have done for himself?

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT-AT-LARGE
utterances.sentences: It was something that I would not have recommended. Putting the defendant on the witness stand is always problematic. It's a toss of the dice. More bad things can happen than good, but this kid has stood his ground. You know, this is a self- defense case. Did he reasonably believed that his life was in danger, and was the force he used to defend himself appropriate? And it just seems to me that the kid -- now, he is a dopey kid with a hero complex. You know, he shouldn't have been there. He should not have had the AR-15 and all this and all the rest of it. But I think he walks to tell you the truth. I don't see how they touch him on the murder case, is the most serious charges. You know, the other one, what is it, recklessly endangering? You know, I think there's a reasonable possibility that aside from the possession of the weapon as a minor, you know, I think that Rittenhouse is going to go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Go ahead, judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Well, first of all, I don't think he is dopey kid. Just because he's a Mr. Cool from New York City doesn't make him a dopey kid. OK? This kid practice CPR, trained, he was a police explorer, he was a fire --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: He's a 17-year-old guy, that kid that takes --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: You know what, what should he be doing --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- his AR-15 to a neighboring state?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: You know what, you don't know what it's like in that part of the country, and maybe you do.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I do. I lived there.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: You do, you lived there. It's a part of life for them. And you know what, the charges for possession of that weapon, nine months, because he's under 18.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I think that's the only one they got.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: So, let's not -- let's not conflate the issues.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That's the one they have.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That's a good kid, that is a kind of kid who can grow up and have a moral core.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Jesse, earlier today, the defense didn't move and asked for a mistrial because of the prosecutor.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: The prosecutor is a joke. Not only has he exhibited prosecutorial misconduct. He coached a witness to lie and got caught cold. I've never seen anything like this guy. It's now illegal to defend yourself. If someone is assaulting you, chasing you, grabbing your weapon, shooting firearms over your head, and then aiming a revolver at your skull, this prosecutor says you can't defend yourself. That is insane. This all started with Jacob Blake. The prosecutor's office, corrupt Democrat district attorneys, release a falsely edited piece of footage to make it look like this was a cold- blooded racial execution attempt, when in fact Blake was a bad guy who was a rapist and had a knife, and was a danger to police officers and those people in that car. That all didn't come out until later. But at that point, that inflamed such hostility in the streets -- this is a very tender moment, remember this is just after --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- the situation we saw in Minneapolis. So all of a sudden, people start looting and rioting for three straight days. Millions of dollars in damage. Politicians basically told the police to stand down. They weren't doing anything to stop this.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Unfortunately, some of these small business owners had to call in help, and this guy -- listen to the call, I agree that he shouldn't have had a gun, probably shouldn't be there, but that's what happens when you treat police like garbage and politicians tell them not to defend law and order. All right? So, he gets out clear self-defense. Everybody that sees the footage knows that. What do they do? The media comes out and smears this guy as a white supremacist. Joe Biden comes out during the campaign it puts out a tweet linking Donald Trump, says white supremacy with a picture of Rittenhouse with the AR. That's slander straight up. And then, this corrupt prosecutor goes out and throws a (Inaudible) nasty charges at this guy because he wants to run for D.A. He has already run for D.A. once. This guy has got political aspirations. This is an axis bevel. This is prosecutors, the press, and politicians conspiring to create violence, create a deadly situation. And then, when a deadly violent situation happens, they want a scalp of this kid. And that is -- that is really corrupt.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I just want to show that one thing. We have the sound from the judge scolding the prosecution then we're going to go to Greg.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE SCHROEDER, JUDGE, KENOSHA COUNTY CIRCUIT COURT
utterances.sentences: I was astonished when you began your examination, by commenting on the defendant's post-arrest silence, that's basic law. It's been basic law in this country for 40 years, 50 years. I have no idea why you would do something like that. And it gives -- well, I'll leave it at that. So, I don't know what you're up to.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So, that happened -- that happened earlier today, Greg. And then there is just another angle on this and that is the media coverage at the time and since, and if there's any sort of revisiting of that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. As Jesse pointed out, the media coverage of the Jacob Blake thing led to this in so many ways because what they did was they excused the rampant violence, they cheered the reduction of police. And what did that do? It creates a void. Who fills that void? Well, sometimes thugs do, but other times well-meaning citizens who have had enough. That is the story that is old as time that when there is no police, you become the policeman, hence the reason why you have cops. But I've learned a lot from this prosecutor. Number one, you have to let someone beat you over the head with a skateboard. If you defend yourself, that's on you. You should never shoot a guy pointing a gun at you because he hasn't shot you yet. And remember that. He made that very clear. You know, he hasn't shot you yet. And when a guy comes at you with a gun up close, he probably won't shoot you because he could have shot you maybe 10 feet earlier. However, he probably would have had a better chance to kill you up close. But that never would have happened because he would have done it already. And some - - but the bottom line is somebody pointing a gun at you is not enough for self-defense. You must be shot first. What -- the bottom line and Jesse nailed it. Rittenhouse was doing a policeman's job because he could no longer rely on the state or the politicians to provide cover protection for the police. The city was burning and going to hell unabated. So, this kid, rightly or wrongly, acting probably on his own instincts, felt that he could help. I love Jeffrey Toobin's take today where he says Rittenhouse is lucky that he's not on trial for being an idiot. And this is a guy who should --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: This is Toobin?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. He should be really thinking about a concealed permit before going after Toobin, you know what I'm saying?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But I think that what you're going to see now is if the media -- if the media deliberately blocks this information from coming out and instead -- because for example, you never would have known that Gaige had pointed the gun at this guy if you've been following the media's coverage of this. Therefore, if he is acquitted, you're going to have the same thing where people go, oh, my god, white guy -- white guy acquitted. He could do whatever he wants. Even though he shot white people, it doesn't matter because our -- because our media is interested in the racial divide more than anything. They're going to make it about race. Rex Chapman already did it on Twitter. And then, what's going to happen is you're going to have the activist class egged on by the media once again at CNN saying, you know, it is time to scream and yell and yes restorative justice can't take the shape of looting and arson. But that's because we are now in the business of misinforming the public to create conflict.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We have a montage that our team put together of some of the media coverage. If you could roll that for us, please.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: To defend the actions of a 17-year-old man who killed two protesters, one of which was armed with a skateboard. And the last time I checked, I don't think a skateboard could kill someone.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: A 17-year-old kid from out of state, a boy from out of state, drives up to the state with an AR-15 around his neck, shoots and kills a couple of people, shooting wildly, running around acting like rent- a-cop.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And it's not good that a 17-year-old vigilante, arguably a domestic terrorist, picked up a rifle drove to a different state to shoot people.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: What's the name of this guy?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So, the media continue -- Hellmann -- the media continued to -- I mean, basically, Baskin Glory I guess is one of these things. As the judge goes forward with this -- with this request from the defense for a mistrial, is that a possibility?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: You know, I don't think at this point the judge is going to grant the request for a mistrial. But I do have something to say about the judge and the way the judge acted in this case. The judge lost it and he lost it for good reason. What you've got is the prosecution, crossed the line that is as old as the constitution where you have a right to not incriminate yourself. And the -- and the prosecution is trying to make this kid someone who is not entitled to the right to remain silent. You know from every TV show you ever watch, you have a right to remain silent. But this prosecutor is saying, this is the first time you talked about it since you -- since this thing happened as if therefore you're not entitled to have the right to remain silent. And everyone in their mind when they go into the jury room is going to say, gee, I wonder. He had to think it all through and work it all through. That's a fundamental mistake by the prosecution. So, when the judge says, why would you even do that, I can't figure out why you would do it, the prosecution wants to push a mistrial here because the prosecution knows they're losing. This kid is one of the best witnesses I've seen on the witness stand without a doubt. He has an uncanny sense for what to say and when to stop.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, and he's -- and he's fighting for his life. We're going to go back to the trial in just a moment. We're getting one more comment from Geraldo and Jesse. Geraldo, you first.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The defense does not want a mistrial at this stage. The defense is winning. This is not -- this is not a domestic terrorist. It is clear that the image that was built is built on false Legos, that this is a 17-year- old kid, again, I go back, a dopey mistake, hero complex, I can save my community. I'm -- you know, I'm just like all those great people --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You just described people that joined -- that joined the military. They're usually 17.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Maybe so. Maybe so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They want to help -- they want to help their society.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Understand that I am announcing that I believe he's going to be acquitted.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: This -- the prosecution missed the mark. The prosecution tried every dirty trick they possibly could. The facts don't work for the prosecution. The kid was reasonable in his use of force and deadly force and that's what it's about.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Geraldo, don't you think that once the D.A. had the drone information, had the information from the witnesses, they should have at least offered a plea here because the D.A. jumped. In 48 hours, you indict in a case like this, you don't even know the facts in 48 hours. There should have been some recognition that this was a loser case.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I wonder at what point right the defense knew that they were going to put the kid on. I want to know if they led the prosecution down the primrose path, to then whack them with a kid that was impenetrable from the point of view of this lame prosecutor.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: We've known for a long time that the drone video has been out there. We've known that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But when -- whether the kid was going to testify. I didn't know the kid was going to testify.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, but we don't -- obviously, you don't have to tell anybody your kid -- that he's going to --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You're right. Let's get Jesse.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Go ahead, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The montage we showed of the press, that was so sinister. They have lost control of information in America. They used to have total control. So, they used to go on TV and lie. They used to -- you look at the headlines covering this story. It's almost like they're watching a different trial than the rest of the country. We have the internet now. We see all different angles of footage. We can actually watch testimony live. And they are trying to sell a lie to their audience because maybe their audience isn't watching or maybe the audience wants to be lied to.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Can I say one thing?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Because they're not interested in the truth, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: One thing. We have to be careful not to be rooting for the kid, you know what I mean?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm rooting for justice, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Yes. That's what --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And they should be rooting for that too.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: As long as we are rooting for justice.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Sometimes things goes sideways from their narrative, you move the narrative towards the truth, and they have not done that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The kid shouldn't have not been there, but they shouldn't have not threatened him with their pistols, they shouldn't have whacked his head with the skateboard.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This is clear self-defense, Geraldo. Everybody knows that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I am saying it is a reasonable --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, it's funny. It's hard not to personalize this but I keep thinking like, OK, you know -- they keep saying, he went straight -- across state lines. It's actually pretty close to where he lives. It's where he works, right? It's where he works.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: His father lives in Kenosha.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, so I'm thinking --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Got it. Got it. Got it. I know that. What I'm saying is, if I were 17 and my community was being destroyed and I had -- and I was there and I had these skills -- and again, I'm 17 and I am an optimistic, hopeful person, and I'm watching my community be destroyed, which -- would I hide in my house? I don't know what I would do, but I would definitely be outside and I would definitely go and see what I could do. I don't know if I would have a gun because California, it's different. But I would have been there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And for the most part, as he's testified and as witnesses have testified, he was putting out fires and delivering medical aid. That's what he was up to.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That was the least believable part of his testimony.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, but -- no, they have videotape --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Really? Well, because witnesses testified to the same thing, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO

utterances.speaker: RIVERA

utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I confess on a comic relief note to experiencing some joy when my least favorite Congressman Adam Schiff got spanked in broad daylight on The View, finally being forced to answer for his toxic role in promoting the totally discredited phony Trump Russia dossier that tortured then-President Trump and put the country through hell, utter hell. Watch Schiff squirm through this tough line of questioning from Morgan Ortagus.

utterances.speaker: REP. ADAM SCHIFF (D-CA)
utterances.sentences: The President also sought to get --

utterances.speaker: MORGAN ORTAGUS, CO-HOST, THE VIEW
utterances.sentences: You made -- help spread disinformation yourself for years by promoting this. I think that's what Republicans and what people who entrusted you as the Intel Committee Chair are so confused about your culpability in all this.

utterances.speaker: SCHIFF
utterances.sentences: Well, I completely disagree with your premise. It's one thing to say allegations should be investigated and they were. It's another to say that we should have foreseen in advance that some people were lying to Christopher Steele which is impossible of course to do. But let's not use that as a smokescreen to somehow shield Donald Trump's culpability for inviting Russia to help him in the election, which they did. None of that is undercut, none of that serious misconduct is in any way diminished by the fact that people lied to Christopher Steele.

utterances.speaker: ORTAGUS
utterances.sentences: No, I think just your credibility is.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: His credibility is non-existent. This was totally BS. And it put the country, Judge, through agony and it tortured him and I think made him crazy. It was awful.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: It made who crazy?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: President Trump.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, I don't think it made him crazy.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I mean, not literally crazy.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: It would have made me crazy but I think he kind of held it together.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Right. Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: But here's the thing.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But he did hold it together.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: This guy, Schiff, he's a sack of Schiff. You know, this is a guy who --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Can you say that slowly?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Sack of Schiff. This guy is constantly running around saying I've got the evidence, I've got proof beyond a reasonable doubt. And even in his denial, he says, we can't -- we can't shield Trump from inviting Russia -- asking Russia to help him in the election. I mean even if -- when he showed to be a liar that he didn't have any evidence, he didn't have proof beyond a reasonable doubt, he's not willing to apologize for it, we hated each other in America. Families didn't talk to each other about Russian collusion.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Still in my family.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: For the first time, and they're still talking about it, is that Russia and not China is the biggest enemy of the United States at this point. I think he's a pathetic individual and I don't believe a word he says.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And I think to Judge's -- to Judge's point, that this led -- figure in the chain -- remember the chain of events. This led I think directly to the first impeachment. This unsettled the republic in a way that was very profound for what the third time in American history. This is not a little thing that this punk did.

At this point, we're going to find out the election was rigged, Greg. I'm just waiting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It was.

utterances.sentences: Completely. Sure.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- probe was carried out. And there was no fair play for the president. utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. They are now as radical as Abby Hoffman. Like, we're all now on the same side as Glenn Greenwald and Matt Taibi because we all now saw what they had seen years ago. But where -- my question is where is the legitimate reckoning for this five-year hoax? Like, what can you do? Because clearly, he's not going to be voted out. This guy thinks -- he's still going to run. And by the way, why does he keep saying erection instead of insurrection? What's up with that?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Who, Schiff?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: PIRRO

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, they're sensible. Look, here's the bottom line. We have never been torn apart as a country as we were by this Russia collusion delusion. They divided us.

utterances.sentences: It is horrible. My family is split.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It's terrible. It's terrible.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
